artist: Painter: After Rembrandt Harmensz. van Rijn; Engraver: Francis Vivares
description: two images glued on one sheet, numbered upper right 1 and 2; 1: The Quack seller wearing a soft cap and a coat with ruffles at collar and cuff; holding a sample in right hand; basket around waist 2: two figures, an old woman at left and a man at right; the woman stooped and with a hump; carrying a basket; the man wearing a tall peaked cap; leaning on a cane with right hand; left hand bahing back
dimension:
2 7/8 × 2 1/16 in. (7.3 × 5.24 cm) (image, sheet, top image)
3 1/8 × 2 1/8 in. (7.94 × 5.4 cm) (image, sheet, lower image)
11 7/8 × 9 13/16 in. (30.16 × 24.92 cm) (mount)
inscription:
Signature, Date, and Inscription
in black: 1/ Rembrandt  FV 1635 | 2/ FV Fecit  RH 1620
title: Print
